body_html:
'users/search' gets the params through the users_controller. If you don't go through that controller, the search field will send a 'no filter'-param to the search method.
That may explain why you can't cut and paste, but offers no solution. I think render partial: 'views/users/search' would request the right page but I expect that it is not solving your question.
I just learned :-) how to show a form on a different page with js and ajax. Maybe we could go that way?

body:
'users/search' gets the params through the users_controller. If you don't go through that controller, the search field will send a 'no filter'-param to the search method.
That may explain why you can't cut and paste, but offers no solution. I think  `render partial:  'views/users/search'` would request the right _page_ but I expect that it is not solving your question.
I just learned :-) how to show a form on a different page with js and ajax. Maybe we could go that way?
